properties.name: contain
properties.value: none | strict | content | [ [size | inline-size] || layout || style || paint ]

values.name: inline-size
values.prose: This value turns on inline-size containment for the element. This prevents the inline-size of its principal box from directly depending on its contents.

values.name: size
values.prose: Establishes a query container for container size queries on both the inline and block axis. Applies layout containment, style containment, and size containment to the principal box.

values.name: inline-size
values.prose: Establishes a query container for container size queries on the container’s own inline axis. Applies layout containment, style containment, and inline-size containment to the principal box.

values.name: normal
values.prose: The element is not a query container for any container size queries, but remains a query container for container style queries.

properties.name: container-name
properties.computedValue: the keyword none, or an ordered list of identifiers

values.name: none
values.prose: The query container has no query container name.

values.name: <custom-ident>
values.prose: Specifies a query container name as an identifier. The keywords none, and, not, and or are excluded from this <custom-ident>.

properties.name: content-visibility
properties.appliesTo: elements for which size containment can apply

atrules.name: @container
atrules.prose: The @container rule is a conditional group rule whose condition contains a container query, which is a boolean combination of container size queries and/or container style queries. Style declarations within the <block-contents> block of an @container rule are filtered by its condition to only match when the container query is true for their element’s query container.

values.name: portrait
values.prose: The orientation container feature is portrait when the value of the height container feature is greater than or equal to the value of the width container feature.

values.name: <size-feature>
values.prose: A container size query allows querying the size of the query container’s principal box. It is a boolean combination of individual size features (<size-feature>) that each query a single, specific dimensional feature of the query container. The syntax of a <size-feature> is the same as for a media feature: a feature name, a comparator, and a value. [mediaqueries-5] The boolean syntax and logic combining size features into a size query is the same as for CSS feature queries. (See @supports. [CSS-CONDITIONAL-3])

values.name: <style-feature>
values.prose: A container style query allows querying the computed values of the query container. It is a boolean combination of individual style features (<style-feature>) that each query a single, specific property of the query container. The syntax of a <style-feature> is either the same as for a valid declaration [CSS-SYNTAX-3], a supported CSS property, or a <custom-property-name>.
